sentence: Accessible Keys for Video[Space Bar] toggles play/pause;[Right/Left Arrows] seeks the video forwards and back (5 sec );[Up/Down Arrows] increase/decrease volume;[M] toggles mute on/off;[F] toggles fullscreen on/off (Except IE 11);The [Tab] key may be used in combination with the [Enter/Return] key to navigate and activate control buttons, such as caption on/off.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the accessibility features of a video player and does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on monetary policy.

sentence: I appreciate the opportunity to speak at a conference with the important theme of economic measurement.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or stance on the direction of interest rates or the economy. It simply expresses gratitude for speaking at a conference on economic measurement, which has no direct implications on monetary policy.

sentence: In many spheres of human endeavor, from science to business to education to economic policy, good decisions depend on good measurement.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the importance of good measurement in various fields, without directly addressing the stance or implications of the FOMC.

sentence: One great pioneer in this subject area, of course, is Simon Kuznets, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1971 for his work on economic measurement, including the national income accounts.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses Simon Kuznets' contribution to economic measurement and his Nobel Prize, which does not directly impact the current stance of monetary policy.

sentence: Over the years many economists have built on his work to further improve our ability to quantify aspects of economic activity and thus to improve economic policymaking and our understanding of how the economy works.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the contributions of economists in improving economic policymaking and understanding of the economy, without directly addressing any specific stance or implications on monetary policy.

sentence: The remarkably broad and ambitious research program of this conference and the impressive expertise that has been assembled illustrate the continued vitality of this field.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the research program and expertise of a conference, which does not directly impact the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards monetary policy.

sentence: As we think about new directions for economic measurement, we might start by reminding ourselves of the purpose of economics.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the purpose of economics and does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance. It suggests a broader discussion on economic measurement rather than specific policy implications.

sentence: Textbooks describe economics as the study of the allocation of scarce resources.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it provides a general definition of economics and does not directly address any specific policy stance or implications.

sentence: The ultimate purpose of economics, of course, is to understand and promote the enhancement of well-being.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the ultimate purpose of economics, which is not directly related to the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) in determining whether to adopt hawkish, dovish, or neutral monetary policies.

sentence: Economic measurement accordingly must encompass measures of well-being and its determinants.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it emphasizes the importance of economic measurement encompassing well-being and its determinants. While it acknowledges the need for comprehensive measures, it does not explicitly lean towards a hawkish, dovish, or irrelevant stance.

sentence: In the tradition of national income accounting, economic policymakers have typically focused on variables such as income, wealth, and consumption.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the traditional focus of economic policymakers on variables like income, wealth, and consumption, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: The Federal Reserve has a statutory mandate to foster maximum employment and price stability, which motivates our extensive efforts to monitor and forecast measures of employment and inflation.
reason: This sentence indicates that the Federal Reserve is committed to its statutory mandate of achieving maximum employment and price stability. It highlights their extensive efforts to monitor and forecast employment and inflation measures, suggesting a neutral stance towards US monetary policy.

sentence: Substantial research and the development of data collection infrastructures have, over the years, greatly enhanced our ability to receive timely and accurate measures of those variables.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the advancements in research and data collection infrastructures, which do not directly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Aggregate measures, such as gross domestic product and personal consumption expenditures, are useful for monitoring people's ability to meet basic material needs and for tracking cyclical and secular changes in the economy as a whole.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the usefulness of aggregate measures for monitoring economic changes and meeting basic material needs, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Indeed, the experience of the recent financial crisis and the ensuing recession was strongly reflected in nearly all of these aggregate measures, indicating the severe economic stress felt by millions of people and hundreds of communities across the country.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the impact of the recent financial crisis and recession on people and communities, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: For example, even though some key aggregate metricsââincluding consumer spending, disposable income, household net worth, and debt service paymentsââhave moved in the direction of recovery, it is clear that many individuals and households continue to struggle with difficult economic and financial conditions.
reason: This sentence suggests that despite certain positive indicators of economic recovery, there are still many individuals and households facing challenging economic conditions. It implies a dovish stance on US monetary policy, as it highlights the need for continued support and assistance to address these difficulties.

sentence: Exclusive attention to aggregate numbers is likely to paint an incomplete picture of what many individuals are experiencing.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. It implies that focusing solely on overall economic indicators may not accurately reflect the diverse experiences of individuals. Therefore, policymakers may consider a more nuanced approach, taking into account individual circumstances, which aligns with a dovish perspective.

sentence: One implication is that we should increase the attention paid to microeconomic data, which better capture the diversity of experience across households and firms.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy. By emphasizing the need to focus on microeconomic data that reflects the diverse experiences of households and firms, it implies a cautious approach that prioritizes understanding the real economy.

sentence: Another implication, however, is that we should seek better and more-direct measurements of economic well-being, the ultimate objective of our policy decisions.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. While it acknowledges the need for improved measurements of economic well-being, it does not explicitly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or irrelevant stance towards policy decisions.

sentence: Although the field is still young, there have been interesting developments in the measurement of economic well-being.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the measurement of economic well-being, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) in determining whether to adopt hawkish, dovish, or neutral monetary policy stances.

sentence: In a commencement address two years ago titled "The Economics of Happiness," I spoke about the concepts of happiness and life satisfaction from the perspective of economics and other social science research.1   Following the growing literature, I define "happiness" as a short-term state of awareness that depends on a person's perceptions of one's immediate reality, as well as on immediate external circumstances and outcomes.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the concepts of happiness and life satisfaction from an economic and social science perspective. It does not provide any information or implications related to the monetary policy stance, making it unrelated to the terms hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: By "life satisfaction" I mean a longer-term state of contentment and well-being that results from a person's experiences over time.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the concept of "life satisfaction" and its definition, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: Surveys and experimental studies have made progress in identifying the determinants of happiness and life satisfaction.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses surveys and experimental studies on happiness and life satisfaction, which do not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: Interestingly, income and wealth do contribute to self-reported happiness, but the relationship is more complex and context-dependent than standard utility theory would suggest.2   Other important contributors to individuals' life satisfaction are a strong sense of support from belonging to a family or core group and a broader community, a sense of control over one's life, a feeling of confidence or optimism about the future, and an ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses factors contributing to individuals' life satisfaction, which is not directly related to the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence:
Indeed, an interesting finding in the literature is that the overwhelming majority of people in the United States and in many other countries report being very happy or pretty happy on a daily basisââa finding that researchers link to people's intrinsic abilities to adapt and find satisfaction in their lives even in very difficult circumstances.3 

       This line of research has generated alternative measures of well-being that are frequently survey-based and incorporate elements such as psychological wellness, the level of education, physical health and safety, community vitality and the strength of family and social ties, and time spent in leisure activities.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses alternative measures of well-being and does not provide any information or implications related to the monetary policy stance.

sentence: These measures have begun to inform official statistics and have started to be discussed in policy debates.

It implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it does not indicate a clear preference for either hawkish or dovish actions, but rather highlights the relevance and impact of these measures.

sentence: An interesting and unique case is the Kingdom of Bhutan, which abandoned tracking gross national product in 1972 in favor of its Gross National Happiness index based on a survey that incorporates these types of indicators.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Kingdom of Bhutan's decision to prioritize its Gross National Happiness index over tracking gross national product. It does not provide any implications on the US monetary policy, making it irrelevant.

sentence: Taking the measurement of well-being in a cross-country framework, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), as part of its OECD Better Life Initiative, has created a "better life index" that allows a side-by-side comparison of countries according to various quality-of-life indicators that could, at least in principle, be followed over time.4   Other somewhat-more-conventional economic indicators that bear on quality of life, and that accordingly might be developed and followed in more detail, include changes in the distribution of income, wealth, or consumption; the degree of upward mobility in material measures of well-being; indications of job security and confidence about future employment prospects; and households' liquidity buffers or other measures of their ability to absorb financial shocks.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the measurement of well-being and quality of life indicators, which are not directly related to monetary policy decisions.

sentence: All of these indicators could be useful in measuring economic progress or setbacks as well as in explaining economic decisionmaking or projecting future economic outcomes.

It is irrelevant to determine whether the sentence is hawkish, dovish, or neutral as it does not directly address any specific policy stance.

sentence: Continued work on the measurement of economic well-being will likely lead to greater recognition by economists of the contributions of psychology--an area that has been explored by pioneers like 2002 Nobel laureate Daniel Kahneman.

sentence: One topic on the frontier of economics and psychology is the neurological basis of human decisions, including decisionmaking under risk and uncertainty, intertemporal choice, and social decisionmaking.5   Researchers are investigating behavioral tendencies in a variety of circumstances--for instance, by examining human responses to perceived inequality, losses, risk, and uncertainty; the need for autonomy; and the importance for well-being of social ties and community.
